minister noun [C]
(POLITICIAN)

B2 a member of the government in Britain and many other countries who is in charge of a particular department or has an important position in it: the foreign/health minister the Minister of/for Education
More examplesFewer examples"The matter is closed, " said the health minister.The minister accused his opponent of being a crypto-communist.At this point in the speech, the minister departed from his prepared text.The minister dodged questions about his relationship with the actress.The minister was drummed out of office when it was discovered that he had been taking bribes.
